intro: Aylostera oculata subsp. tilcarensis, commonly known as the Tilcarensis Aylostera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
